comment: The lectures were a drag to sit through and he wasn't that helpful when it came to the homework assignments even in office hours. If you can learn the material on your own, you're good to go but I personally wouldn't take him.

Professor Shi is awesome at KSU. His lecture notes are really valuable, and if you pay attention, you'll learn a lot. The course has just 5 homework assignments and 2 tests all semester, so the grading is fair and you can often get better scores than you expect.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Terrible professor, I have 0 fluid mechanics knowledge after completing this course. I would never take him for any other class. Take someone else if you can. Lectures and lecture notes are useless, you can get a good grade by showing up but the class is not good overall.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One of the best professors I've had in recent years. The homework is almost identical to the exams so make sure you pay attention and do the work. Would definitely take his class if you want a good grasp of fluids and a high grade (he hates giving out C's or lower grades but he will give them out, so don't slack off ).
Best fluid mechanics professor at kennesaw state, Professor Shi knows his material and teaches it very well. Few homeworks but all are easy. TAKE HIM!!!

Professor Shi is an outstanding fluid mechanics instructor. His lectures are clear, engaging, and surpass other professors at KSU. He is knowledgeable, patient, and understanding, fostering a positive learning environment. The final grading is unexpectedly high, and I highly recommend his courses for anyone interested in fluid mechanics.
